MEDIAN_AGE:
It seemns that each increase of median_age increases the number of incidents by 2253, holding all others regressors constant.
    So the median_age is associated woth a positive effect on the number of crimes incidents.
T_STAT:
The t-statistics associated with the median age regressor is 1.82. 
    The t-statistic is used in a t-test to determine whether to support or reject the null hypothesis.
    It is very similar to the Z-score but with the difference that t-statistic is used when the sample size is small.
    It is computed like this: T = (sample mean - global mean)/sample standard deviation.
    As the sample size n is not large enough and we don't know the true population Ïƒ, 
    so the Z-score cannot be approximated by a normal distribution and cannot be computed without knowing true population 
    (global standard deviation). So we can use the t-statistic that can be approximated by a Student t-distribution.
P_VALUE:
p-value is not very small, bigger than the confidence interval (p-value > 0.05) so we cannot say it is significant.
    Same for a 90% confidence level (p-value > 0.10)
INCREASE:
Holding all others regressors constant, the total number of incidents decrease by 2115 when the share of families 
    with a married couple increases by 1 percentage point in the district.
LIMITATIONS: A very high R-squared can be due to the overfitting of the model. Maybe it is due to outliners in the dataset.
